items.name: Provisional-license fintech (UK)
items.why_now: UK Regulatory Innovation Office + provisional licenses regime 2025; time-limited FCA auth for controlled environments.
items.description: Build a product for early-stage fintechs navigating provisional license: compliance tooling or capital/insurance for provisional-phase risk.
items.target_segment: UK fintechs seeking FCA authorization; first product 2025–2026.
first_steps: Map provisional regime timeline and requirements.
Interview 5–10 firms in pipeline; design compliance or risk product.

items.name: Agent-infrastructure for vertical workflows
items.why_now: Agent economy (Cursor, Bolt, Lovable); MCP/orchestration; inference at edge (OpenInfer). Small teams doing $100M ARR.
items.description: Vertical agent stack: orchestration + tools + data for one domain (e.g. legal, ops), sold to SMBs.
items.target_segment: SMBs in professional services or ops; 10–50 person teams.
first_steps: Pick vertical; define minimal agent workflow (3–5 steps).
Ship MVP with MCP-compatible tools; 3 design partners.

items.name: Gen Z–first social + quick commerce
items.why_now: 53% Gen Z buy via Instagram/TikTok; 65% value 2hr delivery; 24% use GenAI for shopping; 13% spending pullback = value-seeking.
items.description: Brand or aggregator that combines social discovery, GenAI recommendations, and 2hr delivery with transparent value pricing.
items.target_segment: Gen Z urban consumers; D2C brands targeting them.
first_steps: Validate willingness to pay for “2hr + social + AI recs” bundle.
Partner with one quick-commerce or social platform for pilot.
